intro: Agoseris heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its variable leaf shapes and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its leaves are often alternate and can range from basal to upright, depending on environmental conditions. Agoseris heterophylla is known for its ability to thrive in arid environments, making it an important component of native plant communities.
